articles.headline: U.S. to Retain Role as a Jailer in Afghanistan
articles.snippet: The United States military will continue indefinitely to operate a section of the Parwan complex holding foreign combatants, even as the two countries mark a transfer of authority.
articles.abstract: The United States military will continue indefinitely to operate a section of the Parwan complex holding foreign combatants, even as the two countries mark a transfer of authority.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States military will maintain control over dozens of foreign detainees in Afghanistan for the indefinite future, even as the two countries prepare to ceremonially mark the hand-over of detention operations to the Afghan government, officials from both countries say.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage and Graham Bowley

articles.headline: Greek Government and Public at Odds Over New Cuts
articles.snippet: Greece is running out of cash while international lenders push through austerity measures. The required cuts may force a confrontation between Athens and the public.
articles.abstract: Greece is running out of cash while international lenders push through austerity measures. The required cuts may force a confrontation between Athens and the public.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS — Anastasia Kastaniotou, a struggling mother of three, stood near the Greek Parliament building on Wednesday and threw up her hands as she contemplated an €11.5 billion austerity package that her country’s government was trying to tie up this week to keep Greece in the euro.

articles.headline: Smartphone? Presto! 2-Way Radio
articles.snippet: This new variation on electronic communication is quietly winning over millions of mobile device users.
articles.abstract: This new variation on electronic communication is quietly winning over millions of mobile device users.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cave drawings, smoke signals, letters, Pony Express, telegrams, phone calls, text messages. From the dawn of civilization, man has experimented with different modes of communication, each with pros and cons. Smoke signals, for example, contribute to far fewer car accidents than text messages. Text messages, on the other hand, leave much less soot.

articles.headline: Qatar Imperils Big Merger of Commodity Companies
articles.snippet: The wealthy emirate, which is a shareholder in the big mining company Xstrata, may hold out for a higher price in a proposed merger with Glencore International, which trades in raw materials.
articles.abstract: The wealthy emirate, which is a shareholder in the big mining company Xstrata, may hold out for a higher price in a proposed merger with Glencore International, which trades in raw materials.
articles.lead_paragraph: A huge merger in the natural resources business is close to falling apart.

articles.headline: A Clash Over a Spine Treatment
articles.snippet: A researcher in a clinical trial for a device to treat back pain has been intimidated by the device’s maker, Vertos Medical, from reporting his negative findings.
articles.abstract: A researcher in a clinical trial for a device to treat back pain has been intimidated by the device’s maker, Vertos Medical, from reporting his negative findings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dr. Daryl F. Fourney’s role as a lead researcher in a clinical trial for a device to treat back pain began normally enough.

articles.headline: Motorola and Nokia Try to Gain an Edge in the Smartphone Market
articles.snippet: Motorola Mobility and Nokia unveiled their latest smartphones just ahead of Apple’s introduction of its next iPhone.
articles.abstract: Motorola Mobility and Nokia unveiled their latest smartphones just ahead of Apple’s introduction of its next iPhone.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the smartphone market, Apple and Samsung have become the two giants. Is there room for a third?

articles.headline: For Farms in the West, Oil Wells Are Thirsty Rivals
articles.snippet: A race for water is rippling through the drought-scorched heartland, pitting farmers against oil and gas interests that use the water-intensive hydraulic fracturing process.
articles.abstract: A race for water is rippling through the drought-scorched heartland, pitting farmers against oil and gas interests that use the water-intensive hydraulic fracturing process.
articles.lead_paragraph: GREELEY, Colo. — A new race for water is rippling through the drought-scorched heartland, pitting farmers against oil and gas interests, driven by new drilling techniques that use powerful streams of water, sand and chemicals to crack the ground and release stores of oil and gas.

articles.headline: Clinton Delivers Impassioned Plea for Obama Second Term
articles.snippet: Former President Bill Clinton drew sharp lines between the choices voters face, using the economic successes in his presidency as a case for re-electing President Obama.
articles.abstract: Former President Bill Clinton drew sharp lines between the choices voters face, using the economic successes in his presidency as a case for re-electing President Obama.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTE, N.C. — Former President Bill Clinton and President Obama hugged onstage Wednesday night after Mr. Clinton delivered an impassioned plea on behalf of Mr. Obama’s re-election, the 42nd president nominating the 44th to a second term with a forceful and spirited argument that Democratic values would restore the promise of the middle class.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Mark Landler

articles.headline: 4 Years Later, Scarred but Still Confident
articles.snippet: President Obama is making the case that while progress is slow, he is taking America to a better place — and that he will be a better president over the next four years than the last.
articles.abstract: President Obama is making the case that while progress is slow, he is taking America to a better place — and that he will be a better president over the next four years than the last.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTE, N.C. — He warned them in 2008, and when he formally opened his re-election campaign in May, he put it in his speech again. He will “never be a perfect president,” he said, a line he now repeats at stop after stop. The unspoken subtext: It’s not my fault if you didn’t listen or expected too much.

articles.headline: Huge Step Taken by Europe’s Bank to Abate a Crisis
articles.snippet: The European Central Bank took its broadest step yet toward easing the euro zone crisis, throwing its financial clout behind an effort to fend off financial collapse for Spain and Italy.
articles.abstract: The European Central Bank took its broadest step yet toward easing the euro zone crisis, throwing its financial clout behind an effort to fend off financial collapse for Spain and Italy.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — The European Central Bank on Thursday took its most ambitious step yet toward easing the euro zone crisis, throwing its unlimited financial clout behind an effort to protect Spain and Italy from financial collapse.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Steven Erlanger

articles.headline: Ford Expands Offerings for Europe
articles.snippet: Ford Motor Company said it would introduce several models to bolster its struggling European division, including the Edge sport utility vehicle and the Mustang sports car.
articles.abstract: Ford Motor Company said it would introduce several models to bolster its struggling European division, including the Edge sport utility vehicle and the Mustang sports car.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Even during the American auto industry’s collapse three years ago, the Ford Motor Company kept investing heavily in new products for the future. As American auto sales recovered, so did Ford’s revenue and profit in what previously had been its most troubled market.

articles.headline: Buoyed by European Commitment to Buy Debt, Markets Soar to a Four-Year High
articles.snippet: Encouraging unemployment data helped bolster optimism that the rally might last.
articles.abstract: Encouraging unemployment data helped bolster optimism that the rally might last.
articles.lead_paragraph: Decisive moves by the head of the European Central Bank to preserve the euro zone pushed the benchmark American stock index to a four-year high and fueled hopes that the rally would have staying power.
